intro: Heterotheca mariana, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, violet-blue petals surrounding a central disk of yellow flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Heterotheca mariana typically grows in prairies and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
